events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection, resulting in a damaged front bumper and airbags deployed.
The insurance claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident report and photos submitted by the claimant.
An agent with experience in handling vehicle collision claims has been assigned to manage the investigation and communication with the customer.
The insurance company has formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured prompt processing to the customer.
Customer was asked to provide police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair shop estimates to proceed with claim validation.
The claimant has submitted the police report, images of the accident damage, and repair cost estimates as requested by the insurance agent.
The investigation team has begun examining the submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to verify details of the auto collision incident.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision was caused by the other party, and the submitted damage estimates are consistent with the impact.
A fair settlement covering the full repair costs has been proposed to the customer, including a rental car reimbursement during the repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and appreciated the prompt handling of their auto accident claim.
The claim received full approval following customer feedback and internal review, authorizing payment for vehicle repairs and associated expenses.
The insurance company has processed and issued payment to the repair shop and to the customer for the rental car fees as part of the settlement.
All claim activities have been completed and the file has been closed with confirmation from the customer that repairs are finished satisfactorily.
The auto accident claim documentation and case history have been archived securely for future reference and compliance with record-keeping policies.
